pr_title: polish travis build for JDK download and remove complicated travis script

timeline.message: fix #2241 Get rid of overcomplicated travis-build.sh

Polish travis CI build to use external script for JDK downloads (#2255)

This commit replaces use of the default install-jdk.sh copy in Travis CI
with a third party script, following several disruptions of builds due
to an inability to fetch copies of the requested JDK.

See https://github.com/DanySK/Gravis-CI

fix #2241 Get rid of overcomplicated travis-build.sh + show PASSED

Notify PASSED tests so that build doesn't register as stalled.

replies.bodyText: I wanted to specifically avoid STARTED and PASSED, as it creates a lot of noise (10K+ lines of logs that don't tell much). STARTED can be useful sometimes when dealing with a hanging test though, but in that case I would activate it temporarily rather than having it on all the time. Plus having the test class logged would already point us in some direction in that case.
replies.author: simonbasle

replies.bodyText: this was done as a compromise between adding PASSED to testEvents and logging nothing at all (which can fail the build as the tests now sometimes run for more than 10min total on CI)
